author: riga
body:
#### PR description

This PR adds energy regression and particle identification for trackster objects to the `TrackstersProducer` of the `RecoHGCal/TICL` package. Both the regressed energy and ID probabilities for different types of particles (e, mu, gamma, hadron) are the outputs of a single neural network, stored as a TensorFlow model. The first version of this model is proposed in

https://github.com/cms-data/RecoHGCal-TICL/pull/1.

It does not yet produce a regressed energy, however, this PR allows the `TrackstersProducer` to be configured such that it skips the regression / ID / both. Therefore it does not require any changes in the future once the regression is included in the model.

The inference itself supports multi-threading by means of the usual splitting of TensorFlow `Graph` (stored in the global cache) and `Session` objects (one session per stream).

I ran clang-format on the parts of the code I added or updated.
title: Add energy regression and particle identification to RecoHGCal/TICL.
